page.title: 15CUSTOMS FORRES WEST
page.content: Ryding of the Marches is one of the oldest customs in Forres. The Marches begin at Thornhill and walk around the town. The ryders are dressed in different uniforms and the horses have little bo's and beads on them. The Ryding of the Marches is very good to watch and the horses are well trained. The Ryding of the Marches took place this year 1985 on Sunday June 2nd. The speech that was made was broadcasted on Morayfirth Radio for everyone to hear. The Marches were ridden on some of the following dates: June 13th 1558, June 22nd 1615 and April 24th 1649. Sometimes,to gain more land, farmers would shift the stones that marked out the land. This was checked for by Provists, Baillies and Magistrates.
